item.title: Year in Books: 2022
item.description: Fierce People | Dirk Wittenhorn A good first read of the year. A thriller, romance, and coming-of-age novel all wrapped in one. I’m glad I read the book before I’m going to watch the movie. I couldn’t put it down once I started. I wrote an in-depth post so I won’t bore you here. Bright Lights, Big City | Jay McInerney This book presents one of the most elucidated, explicit, and candid portrayals of eighties New York.

item.title: Year in Books: 2021
item.description: Abstract The list of books I have read in 2021 along with thoughts and views on some of them. Enjoy! Zero to One | Peter Thiel Non-fiction, Startup, Essential, Vision, Principles Rosemary’s baby | Ira Levine Fiction, Fantasy, Witchcraft, Classic Vivekananda’s Biography | Swami Nikhelananda Non-fiction, Biography, Monk, Vedanta, Philosophy, Inspiration The Three Body Problem | Cixin Liu Fiction, Hard SF (science fiction), Contact, Classic Transform your Habits | James Clear Non-fiction, Psychology, Self-help, Habits, Short

item.title: Year in Books: 2020
item.description: Let’s Get Started The Rosie Project | Graeme Simsion My first read this year (2020). I started just after taking the last of my annuals and I remember laughing hard. It’s a romcom about a genetic professor suffering from Asperger’s trying to find a wife. The Wife Project still gives me giggles. Oh and I remember picking this up after seeing it on Bill Gate’s to-read list. Daemon | Daniel Suarez A dystopian fiction where a computer program takes “control”.
